quizzes.question_text: Based on the number of right angles this quadrilateral has, is the quadrilateral a rectangle?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Look at each angle in the quadrilateral. To see which are right angles, imaging placing a small square in each one. Note that all 4 angles are marked with the right angle symbol. That means they are right angles, and squares fit in them perfectly.
This quadrilateral has 4 right angles. So, it is a rectangle.
quizzes.backend_description: An orange/red outlined rectangle with small squares positioned at each of its four corners. The rectangle itself is empty (white interior), and the corner squares are also outlined in the same orange/red color.

quizzes.question_text: Based on the number of right angles this quadrilateral has, is the quadrilateral a rectangle?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Look at each angle in the quadrilateral. To see which are right angles, imaging placing a small square in each one. Note that 2 angles are marked with the right angle symbol. Right angles would have squares fit in them perfectly.
This quadrilateral has only 2 right angles. So, it is not a rectangle.
quizzes.backend_description: A green outlined right trapezoid (rotated 270 degrees clockwise) with small squares positioned at 2 adjacent corners (top-left, bottom-left). The right trapezoid itself is empty (white interior), and the corner squares are also in green.

This quadrilateral has only 2 right angles. So, it is not a rectangle.
quizzes.backend_description: A yellow outlined right trapezoid (rotated 270 degrees clockwise) with small squares positioned at 2 adjacent corners (top-left, bottom-left). The right trapezoid itself is empty (white interior), and the corner squares are also in yellow.

quizzes.question_text: Based on the number of right angles this quadrilateral has, is the quadrilateral a rectangle?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Look at each angle in the quadrilateral. To see which are right angles, imaging placing a small square in each one. Note that all 4 angles are marked with the right angle symbol. That means they are right angles, and squares fit in them perfectly.
This quadrilateral has 4 right angles. So, it is a rectangle.
quizzes.backend_description: A pink outlined rectangle (rotated 180 degrees) with small squares positioned at all four corners. The rectangle itself is empty (white interior), and the corner squares are also in pink.

quizzes.question_text: Based on the number of right angles this quadrilateral has, is the quadrilateral a rectangle?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Look at each angle in the quadrilateral. To see which are right angles, imaging placing a small square in each one. Note that all 4 angles are marked with the right angle symbol. That means they are right angles, and squares fit in them perfectly.
This quadrilateral has 4 right angles. So, it is a rectangle.
quizzes.backend_description: A orange/red outlined rectangle with small squares positioned at all four corners. The rectangle itself is empty (white interior), and the corner squares are also in orange/red.
